page.title: 06FRODSHAM COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content: Built at an initial cost of Â£55,000 on land purchased by the Parish Council in 1957,the Centre, the idea of a local headmaster, Rowland Shelbourne, was opened by Lord Leverhulme in 1969. A Â£40,000 extension was completed in 1975. A rent of Â£1.00 per year is paid to the Parish Council. There are 251 members each paying Â£0.50 annually, Â£8.00 for affiliated clubs of which there are 57. The Centre is self financing, staff working voluntarily The main hall is licenced to hold 350 people, having a well equipped stage and the Centre has another 14 other rooms of various sizes used for the many activities. A kitchen provides refreshments and a bar, alcholic drink. Changing rooms with showers are provided for competitors in the annual hill races and other activities. The Centre is now valued at Â£750,000.
